byline.contributor: Elisabeth Malkin reported from Mexico City, and Raphael Minder from Madrid. Susan Beachy contributed research from New York.
byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and RAPHAEL MINDER

abstract: Spanish authorities arrest former Mexican governor Humberto Moreira, who escaped prosecution in his own country, on money laundering charges; critics say politician, close ally of Pres Enrique Pena Nieto, embodies Mexico's culture of political corruption and country's inability to counter it.
lead_paragraph: The news that Humberto Moreira, who governed Coahuila, was being charged with corruption came with an asterisk: It was the Spanish police who succeeded in building a case against him.

headline.main: A Former Mexican Governor Is Arrested, but Not by His Own Country
headline.print_headline: A Former Mexican Governor Is Arrested, but Not by His Own Country

snippet: The news that Humberto Moreira, who governed Coahuila, was being charged with corruption came with an asterisk: It was the Spanish police who succeeded in building a case against him.
